meanings.definition: A low-growing plant with small blue flowers.
meanings.sent1: The brooklime added a touch of color to the garden with its tiny blue flowers.
meanings.sent2: I spotted some brooklime by the stream, its small blue flowers standing out among the greenery.
meanings.sent3: The brooklime whispered to the other plants, 'I may be small, but my blue flowers pack a punch!'
meanings.sent4: The brooklime was like a shy artist, quietly painting the garden with its delicate blue flowers.
meanings.sent5: As I walked by the brooklime, its blue flowers seemed to sparkle in the sunlight, mesmerizing me.

meanings.sent1: I can brooklime the noise from the construction site because I know it will be over soon.
meanings.sent2: She couldn't brooklime the idea of leaving her beloved pet behind.
meanings.sent3: The teacher tried to brooklime the students' silly antics, but eventually, she had to intervene.
meanings.sent4: His patience was a brooklime river, flowing steadily even in the face of chaos.
meanings.sent5: The old tree seemed to brooklime the storm, standing tall and unwavering against the wind.
